What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The basic structure and skills for writing a year-long essay

Learn how to write a thesis: what components are involved, how to read and filter through sources, how to think about methodologies, how to think about framing, etc. Read about research methodologies. Practiced how to analyze primary source materials. Wrote a literature review and/or part of the thesis body.
Developing a research question, writing a long research paperwork in an extended research project a

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course, naturally, reflects the work you take on in your senior project. As such, it can be very (very) stressful; however, the support from both the faulty and other students in the class is amazing. The work isn't necessarily all that much more than you would do in a regular semester, but it is definitely more stressful thus making the work harder to do.

Strengths: Professor Tran and Maryam. They gave wonderful advice in any roadblocks we hit, from developing a research question to the actual writing of the thesis, their feedback was wonderful and helpful.

Weakness: I think the course could be set up in a way that is more conducive to getting actual witting or research done. Some assignments felt not so helpful or applicable to the actual thesis writing. This might be a hot take, but I kind of wish there was more scattered deadlines for waiting through out the semester. I know they encouraged us keep writing but it might have been helpful to have more writing deadlines instead of Cor maybe in addition to) other assignments. Would have also loved t have more worktime during class since some sessions went a bit slow.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: it's a required course for er&m majors

Absolutely. If you're thinking of doing a senior thesis, this class will support you and be of great help. However, if you're lukewarm about doing a senior thesis, I would suggest thinking hard on it beforehand so that your stress does not burdensome / not fulfilling in the end.
